answer: I don't want to. I don't know. It's not like it was when I was with Rachael. Rachael and I used to talk about stuff. We just, I don't know, connected.

question: Very good, Deacon. Deacon is confused.
answer: What do you mean?

question: Oh, nothing. I guess I'm just glad that you finally figured it out. A moment of realization.
answer: Yeah, I guess I did. So I have to do this, don't I?

question: I guess. Or not. Whatever. Deacon smiles. He finally understands that Ashley really does care about him. Ashley kisses him on the cheek and exits off into the horizon.
answer: There's something I want to talk to you about.

question: There's something I want to talk to you about.
answer: What?

question: I've been thinking. Maybe we should see other people.
answer: What?

question: Well, I mean, we don't really have anything in common. And we don't really even get along.
answer: You're breaking up with me? Can we still have sex?

question: Listen to what I'm saying, Naomi.
answer: The only reason I went out with you was because I thought you were a nice guy. And now you're breaking up with me?

question: Yeah. I guess so.
answer: If you tell anybody about this... I have a reputation.

question: I won't. You can tell people you dumped me if you want.
answer: Really?

question: Sure. What do I care?
answer: You see? You are a nice guy. She kisses him on the cheek.

question: Just don't tell anyone about the movies. All right? She smiles.
answer: These guys are pornographers! It's Jake, on the bandstand with the mike. He's drunk. They're perverts! They make porno movies in their basement!

question: No one's listening to you, Jake. Give it a rest. Jake gets down to confront the guys.
answer: Oh, really, skidmarks? I know someone who will believe me. Your parents.

question: The web site is in someone else's name. All our records are encrypted. There's no tracing it to us, jerk off.
answer: Oh, really? Well, good thing I took the tape of Ashley masturbating in your basement. When they see that, they'll see what kind of movies their perfect little Deacon is making.

question: Did you make a copy of it?
answer: No.

question: You sent the original tape to my parents?
answer: Yup.

question: Come on, kid. Take it like a man. Vic pulls down Deacon's pants. Mike brings the blades together in a menacing practice chop.
answer: We've got pre-orders! Mike stops and looks back at Vic.

question: What did you say?
answer: We pre-sold copies of our video.

question: How many? Fifty? A hundred?
answer: No. Sixty-three thousand, two hundred twelve.

question: It's a minivan! It can't go that fast!
answer: Looking for something in the mail, Deacon?

question: No, I just--
answer: Maybe something you'd rather not have us see. Deacon goes white.

question: Mom, Dad...
answer: It's too late, Deacon.

question: Wait--
answer: We just want you to know how deeply disappointed we are in you.

question: It's not even in focus. This is really shoddy work. Deacon takes it back from him. So, guys. I decided I'm going to apply to NYU next year. The film school.
answer: Too bad we burned the film. You could have submitted it as your sample.

question: Good idea, Balls. The guys start laughing.
answer: So, I guess we all got what we deserved. No money, no power, no women.

question: Watch where you're going, sphincter boy. But he's dealing with a totally new and improved Deacon now.
answer: I thought I told you not to call me that anymore.

question: What are you going to do about it?
answer: Some people never learn. Matt pulls out a funky remote control. He hits a button and all the monitors come on up and down the hallway. Students stop to look up at them.
